canonical_explanation.text: Safety rules help us stay safe and avoid getting hurt. On the road, we should walk on footpaths, look both ways before crossing, use zebra crossings, and follow traffic lights (red means stop, yellow means wait, green means go). At home, we should not touch fire or hot things, play with sharp objects, or touch electrical sockets. At school and playground, we should not push others, run in corridors, or use equipment unsafely. We should never talk to strangers or take anything from them. If someone makes us uncomfortable, we should tell a trusted adult like a parent or teacher.
rules: On the road: walk on footpath, look both ways, use zebra crossing, follow traffic lights.
Traffic lights: Red = Stop, Yellow = Wait, Green = Go.
At home: do not touch fire, sharp objects, or electrical sockets.
At school: do not push, run in corridors, or fight.
Never talk to strangers or take things from them.
Tell a trusted adult if something is wrong.

questions.question_text: What does a RED traffic light mean?
questions.explanation_correct: A red traffic light means you must stop your vehicle or stop walking. It is important to follow the red light to avoid accidents and stay safe on the road.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A red traffic light does not mean go or run. It means you must stop your vehicle or stop walking and wait until the light turns green before you can go. This helps keep everyone on the road safe and avoid collisions.

questions.question_text: Where should we walk on the road?

options.text: In the middle of the road

questions.explanation_correct: We should walk on the footpath because it is safer for us. The footpath is the area next to the road where people can walk without being hit by cars. This helps us avoid accidents and stay safe while going from one place to another.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not walk in the middle of the road, on the car lane, or behind the bus. These are not safe places for us to walk. The cars and buses could hit us and hurt us. The safest place to walk is on the footpath, which is the area next to the road made for people to walk on.

questions.question_text: What should you do before crossing the road?
questions.explanation_correct: You should look both ways before crossing the road because that helps you see if any cars or bikes are coming. This way you can cross safely without getting hit.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You should not run quickly across the road because that is very dangerous. Cars and bikes may not be able to stop in time if you run out suddenly. You also should not close your eyes or talk on the phone, as you need to be able to see and hear what is happening around you to cross the road safely.

questions.question_text: Which of these is dangerous at home?

questions.explanation_incorrect: Playing with toys, reading a book, and drinking water are all safe things to do at home. However, touching a hot stove can burn your skin and hurt you badly, so that is the dangerous option.

questions.question_text: What does a GREEN traffic light mean?

questions.question_text: Should you touch an electrical socket?
